channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish outside the house, 2nd November
item.description:
Number 37 It’s never clean outside the house. A big box has been left there for weeks. People walking past just through stuff in there. It’s now full. Rubbish all over the place. Do the people living there expect the dustman to take it away. They won’t touch it and it’s been there for weeks. Just ridiculous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17,19, South Lodge Drive, Cockfosters, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian light facing wrong way, 2nd November
item.description:
Pedestrian light facing wrong way. Been like this for months. Guess it got knocked by a van.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Nelson Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Blocking the path and cross way, again, 2nd November
item.description:
Inconsiderate renters leaving the rental bikes in the way of the crossing. This makes it impossible worth a wheelchair to negotiate safely. Please deal with the companies or better still ban them from the pathways. Regards, Mrs Grange.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ebury Bridge Road, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown ivy/vines on perimeter of Trafalgar house, 2nd November
item.description:
Ivy/vine is overgrown on the fencing at the back of Trafalgar house, growing over into the garden of 40 Date Street. This has been present for several months, growing a lot over the summer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronti Close, Walworth, London

item.title: Sharp dangerous wire fencing in playground, 2nd November
item.description:
Some young boys have been pulling the fencing away from the post in order to gain entrance to the playground in Wharton Rd and have left it pulled away with very sharp edges. The gap is gradually getting worse and the sharp wires could cause injury should anyone try to gain access through the gap. It has been fixed in the past but it is now needing to be secured again properly. This gap is next to the gate in St Timothy’s Mews which is kept locked at all times. The children can gain entrance to the playground legitimately via the gate in Wharton Rd which is kept open at all times.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Timothy's Mews, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop wobbling around, 2nd November
item.description:
This stop has been damaged at the base and is wobbling around It has an e ink bus info display machine attached and just pressing the metal buttons under its screens makes the stop sway around

item.title: Rubbish rarely collected, 2nd November
item.description:
There is a set back area on Huntingdon St next to junction with Crescent St which is used for the flats at 16 Huntingdon St. It's frequently missed by weekly council bin workers and attracts fly tipping and rubbish. The Council needs to ensure that its emptied and the surrounding rubbish cleared then arrange with Refuse Collection that its listed as residential and collected weekly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Huntingdon Street, Barnsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd November
item.description:
